page.title: 18Belhus Mansion.
page.content: Belhus Mansion lies in the parish of Aveley and was the seat of the Barrett family from the 14th century to 1644 when Edward Barrett died and it passed into the Lennard family. The original house was extensively altered in the mid_18th century by Lord Dacre,who also made the park resemble a medieval deer park.The famous gardener Capability Brown helped him in this. At the end of the war Belhus Mansion was sold and its contents auctioned.After some years as a private residence it was occupied by troops in the Second World War,became dilapitatedand was finally demolished in 1957. Although the name of Belhus lives on in the area ,only the foundations of the once great house,together with its ice tower remain.
